reviews.text:
We were a bit late and a lot of other places were already closed. I had also very specific ideas in regards to food and just wanted to have a cheese plate with some wine and enjoy our last evening in Tallinn. So we ended up here as they had a cheese platter on offer, had cider and were still open (we arrived at 9:40 pm).
It was a real treat: the staff was very friendly and helpful. And when they didn't have something they recommended something similar. The other people seemed to enjoy their pizza. We had in the end a bit more than planned, but that was ok. I recommend the cheese - it was good.

I’m shocked by this experience at a restaurant that should be avoided at all costs. I walked in without checking the overall Google rating because I was hungry and craving Italian food. I ordered a salmon pizza, but what I received was nothing close to a salmon pizza. For an Italian restaurant, that’s really strange! I spoke with the waitress and shared my disappointment, though she didn’t seem too pleased. But seriously, avoid this place at all costs! My pizza had just a few tiny pieces of salmon, and there was no sign of crème fraîche or mozzarella! Where are we living? I ended up paying €21.50 because I also ordered an apple juice. These are Parisian prices, but at least there, you get quality! Avoid this place! For a country like Estonia, these prices should be more affordable. It’s really excessive.

The pizza was just okay, not that good and yet not all that bad. The risotto was the same, just okay. The service was okay as we had a larger group with the first young lady that looked way over worked, but later a second young lady came over to help and she was much more amiable. The bathroom was clean but you have to walk down a narrow stairs to use it. It’s okay for a quick rest before finishing our day tour of Tallinn.

Maybe it got its name from Italy, but the products were definitely not Italian, an uncooked pasta arrived cold. The staff doesnt seem happy at all, I dont recommend it. It is a bad Italian restaurant. Italians would cry if they ate here!
Our group eat lasagne and pasta carbonara, both not so good. Vine moderate, As well as the charcuterie/cheese plate taken as appetizers. We now know why there were no bookings :(
